relation: Great for these types of students
Share any unusual traditions or locations on campus
the parking lot is very close to the entrance of the building.
i have not been made aware of any clubs or activities.
columbia is great for students with busy schedules. they offer day and evening classes. as well as online classes. they are meant to accommodate your schedule.
columbia has nation-wide campuses. i myself attend the location in gurnee, il. this is what makes this school so great. you can attend from many places around the country.

i attended neiu for a semester and columbia is much more affordable. they don't have an incessant amount of fees or other things to pay besides tuition and books. you are paying a low tuition rate compared to other schools and 4-year universities.

i am enrolled in the online program. many people have a misconception that these classes are easier than in-seat classes, however, they are just as challenging if not more. you have to make sure you are managing your time. online classes still require participation in discussions as well as group projects.

meet with an advisor every step of the way from when you first enroll and are picking your classes, when you choose your major, and when your are unsure if you are on the right track. make sure that you are planning you course schedule in advance so you know when you are taking classes. this makes it easier when it comes time to register. register for classes as early as you can. research the class and professor before registering. plan your finances accordingly, whether that be financial aid, your income, or loans. make sure you are budgeting books, fees, tuition and even other expenses such as the gas you'll be using to get to class.

columbia college is very accommodating when it comes to a student's busy schedule. columbia college's academic advisers are very helpful and always willing to meet with you. columbia college always answers questions and provides solutions to problem or issues you are facing.

textAfterTable: The classes are small and teachers are up close and personal. They notice when you look lost and stay overtime to help you out. They cover a lot of material so there's lots to learn. They DO notice when you're not in class. Login to rate or flag the reviews JC from Mexico, MO 08/06/2011 Reviewer is A current student here. 3 out of 3 people found this review useful. 3 of 49 Categories Comments Great for these types of students Art, science or business majors, international students, students who want a small classroom experience. Tips for prospective students Visit the campus and learn about the programs here that relate to what you are interested in majoring in. If you are set on Columbia College, I recommend making a four year plan and also try to get involved in at least one club or extra curricular activity here at CC. Bang for the buck I'd say Columbia College's tuition
